definitions.text:
laded, laden.
1. To load; to put on or in, as burden or freight. We lade ship with cotton. We lade horse or other beast with corn.And they laded their asses with the corn and departed thence. Genesis 42:26.
2. To dip; to throw in or out, as fluid, with ladle or dipper; as, to lade water out of tub or into cistern.
3. To draw water. [Not in use.]LADE,
